Posts.Content: No ideas on where they or could do the surg even if I would consider it. This was in a smaller mid western city. I believe sign up is in December for prescription plans. The reason he wouldn't do surg was pin involvement, Gleason 8, and the psa he said cases usually meant it had escaped the prostate they found surg was not recommended. He wanted rad and lupron only. It my choice for seed implants. My psa continued to rise while the lupron and the uro added casodex on 4-24-17 and the psa jumped from 3.2 to 6.76 on may 31 they stopped the casodex and sent me med onc. I am to see the uro for my next lupron shot Tuesday and we see about a different referral to med onc.
Posts.Signature: Dx12-14 age 71 Psa40.7 Gleason 8 pin involvement no surgery advised 30 radiation tx seed implants 5-15 lupron started 12-14. Psa 3-15 3.5, 6-15 2.5, 12-15 1.34, 6-16 0.49, 12-16 1.29, 4-17 3.8, 5-17 6.76. Bone scan and Ct neg
Posts.Title: Psa rising hormone therapy not working very concerned

Posts.Content: First let me say cancer really sucks. Just lost a neighbor and dear friend 12 days after being diagnosed with lung ca. Worked in his garden 7 days ago gone now, no heart attack or stroke involved. Lungs filled hemoglobin dropped, vein closaped and he is gone. Now on to my problem. Was diagnosed 2 1/2 years ago, psa was 40, Gleason 8, pin involvement. Uro didn't recommend surgery. Had 30 radiation treatments and seed implants plus lupron injections every 6 month. Psa has been going up since June. Have been treating with uro at veterans hospital. The rad onc recommended that I see a med onc now that I have become hormone therapy resistant. Today I was seen by va med onc. Her recommendations was surg. (Which I was told wouldn't be possible by the uro) and that the psa would go down by not taking the hormones. The psa had gone up from 6.76 to 7.80 in a week. I do need to stay at the Va because I made a foolish decision. I kept my health insurance but didn't get prescription coverage.
Posts.Signature: Dx12-14 age 71 Psa40.7 Gleason 8 pin involvement no surgery advised 30 radiation tx seed implants 5-15 lupron started 12-14. Psa 3-15 3.5, 6-15 2.5, 12-15 1.34, 6-16 0.49, 12-16 1.29, 4-17 3.8, 5-17 6.76. Bone scan and Ct neg
Posts.Title: Psa rising hormone therapy not working very concerned

Posts.Content: So far it hasn't been a problem getting meds from the va. If I were to use my private ins to see a onc they may very choose not to pay for the meds, especially considering the cost them. I served in Vietnam in area with heavy agent orange and this supposed to service connected.

Posts.Title: Psa rising hormone therapy not working very concerned

Posts.Content: Well been lurking for 2 1/2 yrs now coming out. I think most of my stats are listed. Was dx 12/14, dr would not do surg due to gleanson of 8 and pin involvement. Had rad and seed implants, lowest psa went was 0.47. Have had lupron every 6 months. Dec psa 1.21 April 3.8 started casodex May 6.76. Have been treated by va uro. ADT failure according to uro now to onc. I was hoping for a longer performance with the ADT. I not sure what will be next for tx, there many I guess. I will be seeing the onc Tuesday and she is doing another bone scan and Ct. The dr said this is very aggressive ca and my response is is poor and not prolonged
Posts.Title: Hormone resistant prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. Just heard from mo wants to see in a week to discuss options??? They said before nothing to offer until Mets that is why the uro wanted a pet scan to get started sooner.

Posts.Title: Pet scans

Posts.Content: Im on medicare and uro says need a pet scan, due increasing psa. Im castrastion resistant now. Has anyone had any problems with Medicare denying pet scan. We have exhausted all other tx. Still on lupron.
